title: Playpen links from code snippets on doc.rust-lang.org contain wrong code

labels.name: T-rustdoc
labels.description: Relevant to the rustdoc team, which will review and decide on the PR/issue.

body:
For example, the code snippet for [`std::str::StrExt::split`](http://doc.rust-lang.org/std/str/trait.StrExt.html#tymethod.split) shows an arrow in the top-right when hovered over with the mouse. The arrow [is a link to the following page](http://play.rust-lang.org/?code=fn%20main%28%29%20%7B%0A%20%20%20%20let%20s%20%3D%20%22Do%20you%20know%20the%20muffin%20man%2C%0A%20%20%20%20The%20muffin%20man%2C%20the%20muffin%20man%2C%20...%22.to_string%28%29%3B%0A%20%20%20%20%0A%20%20%20%20assert_eq!%28s.replace%28%22muffin%20man%22%2C%20%22little%20lamb%22%29%2C%0A%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%22Do%20you%20know%20the%20little%20lamb%2C%0A%20%20%20%20The%20little%20lamb%2C%20the%20little%20lamb%2C%20...%22.to_string%28%29%29%3B%0A%20%20%20%20%0A%20%20%20%20%2F%2F%20not%20found%2C%20so%20no%20change.%0A%20%20%20%20assert_eq!%28s.replace%28%22cookie%20monster%22%2C%20%22little%20lamb%22%29%2C%20s%29%3B%0A%7D) with suspicious muffin-related content. This seems to be the snippet for the [`std::str::StrExt::replace`](http://doc.rust-lang.org/std/str/trait.StrExt.html#tymethod.replace) function (which is also the first function on the page with example code). All other code snippets on the page lead to the same muffin code.

This is on Chrome 39.0.2171.95 (64-bit) on Mac OS X 10.10.1.

![muffins](http://i.imgur.com/Vmwc8Mx.png)
